attributes.action: scrap plans to fine UK citizens £5000 if they don't tell the govenement their foreign travel plans
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The eborders project means that the goverment will require everyone to inform them in advance of their travel plans including destination, route and duration of trip. Anyone failing to do so could face a fine of £5,000 and not be allowed to travel. This will include day-trippers, and all rail, ferry and air passengers This data will be kept for 10 years and it is unknow which government agencies will have access to the data.

rejection.details:
We believe that some of the information contained in your petition is not accurate. 

The e-borders scheme electronically collects and analyses information collected by carriers (including airlines, ferries and rail companies) about those intending to travel to or from the United Kingdom, rather than from individuals.
reasons: Potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements
